text.section:
At the hearing, the judicial officer shall issue a writ of possession if he finds both of the following:
The plaintiff has established the probable validity of his claim to possession of the property; and
The plaintiff has provided a bond as required by KRS 425.111.

No writ directing the levying officer to enter a private place to take possession of any property shall be issued unless the plaintiff has established that there is probable cause to believe that such property is located there.
